intro: Genista teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces yellow flowers in spring, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rocky or coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value and hardy nature make it a popular choice in gardens and landscaping.
